chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12

result.execSummary:
The defendant Leon Garrett Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Leon Garrett Jr was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Leon Garrett Jr is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Leon Garrett Jr was found guilty of Exposing genitals to a child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).
  • Leon Garrett Jr was found guilty of 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

charges.dispoDesc: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

supervisions.notes:
Provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis if not already done so.
Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.   DOC  to collect monetary sums/amounts at a rate to be determined by DOC up to 50%  of prison funds.   Balance as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count three.  Credit for 391 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
No Contact Order with M.L.T. and/or M.L.T'S MOTHER.
No Contact Order with any children under the age of 16 years, the exception is defendant's biological child-supervised contact only.

Sex Offender evaluation. Comply with recommended treatment/therapy.
Register as a sex offender for the remainder of defendant's life.

supervisions.notes: ** on 11/4/2016 Court advised defendant he cannot possess firearms, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  If defendant possesses a firearm within five (5) years of the completion of this sentence, he will be subject to a three (3) year mandatory Initial Confinement.

Defendant Leon Garrett and Attorney Pamela Moorshead appear via Zoom.   Defendant Leon Garrett in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin via Zoom.  Matter before the Court on defendant's post-conviction motion.  Sworn:  Attorney Robert Haney.  Testimony closed.  Arguments heard.  Court finds testimony of Robert Haney clear and specific with the Court's pretrial rulings in mind.   Court denies defendant's post-conviction motion.   Attorney Moorshead to draft a brief order for State's review an Court's signature.  No further action required on this case.

COURT ENTRY MADE WITHOUT CASE FILE IN COURT:

Defendant Leon Garrett in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant brought to court as the restrictions/warnings were not given at the time of sentencing.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  If the defendant possesses a firearm within 5 years of the completion of this sentence, he will be subject to a 3 year mandatory initial confinement.

Defendant requested a modification to the term of extended supervision to allow for contact with a sibling; Court advises defendant to contact his counsel and bring a motion before the court.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Leon Garrett in court with Attorney Christopher Scott Carson.  Defendant Leon Garrett in custody.  Kevin Shomin, appearing for Abbey Marie DeSiato, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeds.  Defendant disputes some of the agent's comments/conclusions in the presentence investigation report.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

As to Count 2:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  42  months, consecutive to the sentence imposed as to Count 3; with  391 days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  18  months  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  24  months.  

As to Count 3:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  20  years  -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  15  years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -   5  years.  

Court finds defendant is  NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

-  Court sets Restitution at $0  (zero)

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
-  Sex Offender evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment/therapy
-  Seek/Maintain employment
-  No Contact Order with M.L.T.  and/or  M.L.T.'s mother
-  No Contact Order with any children under the age of 16 years; the exception is defendant's biological child - supervised contact only
-  Register as a Sex Offender for the remainder of defendant's life
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at a rate to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections up to 50% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.
Clerk:  jms

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Discharge Summary received and filed Dated 08-30-2016.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Leon Garrett in court with Attorney Robert E Haney.  Sara Volden Schroeder, appearing for Abbey Marie DeSiato, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
At the hour of 3:34 p.m. the jury returned and by their foreperson submitted the following verdicts:
"We, the jury, find the defendant, Leon Garrett, Jr., NOT GUILTY of the offense of Child Enticement in the manner and form as charged in count one of the information."
"We, the jury, find the defendant, Leon Garrett, Jr., GUILTY of the offense of Exposing Genitals in the manner and form as charged in count two of the information."
"We, the jury, find the defendant, Leon Garrett, Jr., GUILTY of the offense of First Degree Sexual Assault of a Child in the manner and form as charged in count three of the information."
All three verdicts - "Dated at Milwaukee, Wisconsin, this 25th day of August, 2016."  - signed by the foreperson

Court polls the jury.  Jury is released and out of the box.

State's motion on the verdicts.  Defense motion notwithstanding the verdicts as to Counts 2 and 3 denied by the Court.
Court grants State's motion and orders judgment of acquittal as to Count 1 and judgment of conviction as to Counts 2 and 3.
State requests remand.  Defense counsel requests PSI.  PSI ordered.
Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.

Court addresses a jury question.   Jury in the box at 3:11 p.m.  Court reads the Allen instruction to the jury.  Jury out of the box at 3:13 p.m.  Court addresses another jury question. Jury out of the box at 3:59 p.m.  Case set for pretrial on 2-25-15 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 44.

Jury in the box at 9:15 a.m.  Sworn-in for the defense: Leon Garrett, Jr.  Defense rests.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of the box at 9:53 a.m.  Defense moves to dismiss. Defendant Leon Garrett in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Final pretrial held in chambers.   Parties stipulate to defendant's prior convictions.  Case remains set for jury trial.

Hearing on State's motion on intent to use videotaped statement proceeds.  Court views the video.  Defense objects to the admissibility of the videotape.   Arguments by counsel.  Court finds the recording is offered before the child's twelfth birthday; there were no obvious stops of the video and one continuous audio/video, no distortion or alterations; the child's development level was inappropriate to be given an oath and expressed an understanding between the truth and a lie; the statement was made to the police officer alone with no coercion and child was advised of the recording so there is no unfair suprise of the video.

Defendant Leon Garrett in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Leon Garrett in custody.  Cindy L. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

State moves to adjourn the jury trial with the understanding that the defendant will be released.  Defense does not object.  Court grants the State's motion to adjourn.  Court finds the defendant's demand for speedy trial cannot be met and releases the defendant on a $10,000 P.R. bond TOT to Justice Point with the conditions: 1) defendant to have no contact with the victim, victim's mother, their residence or place of employment; 2) defendant must make all Court appearances; 3) defendant not to possess firearms or ammunition.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 8, 2014 at 09:00 am.
